title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Control of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Control of 

Exports of Personal Protective Equipment) (No. 2) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (control export personal protective equipment) (no 2) regulation 2020

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations – 

(i) 

Implementing 

“Commission 
Regulation” means 
Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2020/568 of 
23 April 20201 making the exportation of certain products 
subject to the production of an export authorisation. 

(ii) 

“Minister” means the Minister for Business, Enterprise 
and Innovation. 

(2) A word or expression used in these Regulations and which is also used 
in the Commission Implementing Regulation has, unless the context otherwise 
requires, the same meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Commission 
Implementing Regulation.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation - (i) implementing commission regulation mean commission implementing regulation (eu) 2020 568 23 april 20201 making exportation certain product subject production export authorisation (ii) minister mean minister business enterprise innovation (2) word expression used regulation also used commission implementing regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation commission implementing regulation

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 3. (1) The Minister is the competent authority in the State for the purposes
text_raw:
3. (1) The Minister is the competent authority in the State for the purposes 

of the Commission Implementing Regulation. 

(2) The Minister is responsible for the notification obligations provided for 

in Articles 2(7), 3(5) and 4 of the Commission Implementing Regulation.
text_norm: 3 (1) minister competent authority state purpose commission implementing regulation (2) minister responsible notification obligation provided article 2(7) 3(5) 4 commission implementing regulation

heading: 4. The Minister may issue an authorisation for the purposes of Article 2 of
text_raw:
4. The Minister may issue an authorisation for the purposes of Article 2 of

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: (a) An application for an authorisation under Regulation 4 must be
text_raw:
5. 

(a) An application for an authorisation under Regulation 4 must be 
made in accordance with the form specified in Schedule 1. 

(b) The Minister shall issue a decision on an application for an 
export authorisation no later than five working days from the 
date on which all required information has been provided to the 
Minister. 

1 OJ No. L 129, 24.04.2020, p.7 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 8th May, 2020.

(d) 

the Commission

Implementing Regulation, 
the 
application processing time by a further five working days in 
exceptional circumstances and for duly justified reasons. 

the Minister may extend 

In accordance with Article 2(6) of 
the Commission 
Implementing Regulation, applications for exports for use in 
third countries to enable the provisions of emergency supplies in 
the context of humanitarian aid shall be processed as soon as 
possible, but no later than two working days from the date on 
which all required information has been provided to the 
Minister.

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 6. A person who contravenes Article 2(3) of
text_raw:
6. A person who contravenes Article 2(3) of 

the Commission 

Implementing Regulation shall be guilty of an offence.
text_norm: 6 person contravenes article 2(3) commission implementing regulation shall guilty offence

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 7. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 6 shall be liable
text_raw:
7. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 6 shall be liable 

- 

(a) on summary conviction, to a class A fine or to imprisonment for 

a term not exceeding 12 months or both, or 

(b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding €500,000 or 
to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 years or both.
text_norm: 7 person guilty offence regulation 6 shall liable - (a) summary conviction class fine imprisonment term exceeding 12 month (b) conviction indictment fine exceeding eur500 000 imprisonment term exceeding 3 year both

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 8. A summary offence under Regulation 6 may be prosecuted by the
text_raw:
8. A summary offence under Regulation 6 may be prosecuted by the 

Minister.

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 9. The European Union (Control of Exports of Personal Protective
text_raw:
9. The European Union (Control of Exports of Personal Protective 

Equipment) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 84 of 2020) are revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 May, 2020. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Business, Enterprise and Innovation. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [159] 

Schedule 1 

Export authorisation application form 

Application for Export 
Authorisation 

Personal Protective Equipment 

Commission Implementing 
Regulation (EU) 2020/402

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 15. Declaration
text_raw:
15. Declaration 

I, the undersigned, certify that the information provided in this application is true and given in good 
faith, and that I am established in the Union. 

Name of applicant (BLOCK LETTERS): _____________________________________________ 

Signature: _______________________________Date: ___________________Contact Telephone 
No: _________________ 

PLEASE TYPE THE REQUIRED INFORMATION ONTO THE FORM AND RETURN A 
SCANNED COPY OF YOUR SIGNED FORM TO: (exportcontrol@dbei.gov.ie) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [159] 7 

Explanatory note to the export authorisation application form 

The completion of all the boxes is mandatory except when stated otherwise. 

Box 1 

Exporter details 

Box 2 

Recipient details 

Box 3 

Destination Country 

Box 4 

Commodity Code 

Full name and address of the exporter for 
whom the authorisation is issued and EORI 
number if applicable. 

Full name and address of the final recipient 
of the goods, if known at the time of 
issuance and EORI number if applicable. If 
the final recipient is not known at the time 
of issuance, the field is left empty. 

2-letter geonomenclature code of the 
country of destination of the goods for 
which the authorisation is issued. 

The numerical code from the Harmonised 
System or the Combined Nomenclature 
under which the goods to export are 
classified when the authorisation is issued. 

Box 5 

Description of goods Plain language description precise enough 

to allow identification the goods. 

Box 6 

Quantity 

Box 7 

Unit 

Box 8 

Location 

The quantity of goods measured in the unit 
declared in box 7. 

The measurement unit in which the quantity 
declared in box 8 is expressed. The units to 
use are "P/ST" for goods counted by 
number of pieces (e.g. masks). 

If the protective equipment is located in one 
or more Member States other than Ireland, 
please indicate that fact by including the 
geonomenclature code of the Member State 
where the goods are located. If the goods 
are located in Ireland, this box must be left 
empty. 

Box 9 

Information relevant 
to Article 2(6) 

Information relevant to the considerations 
laid out in Article 2(6) of Commission 
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2020/568. 

Box 10 

Information relevant 
to Article 2(7) 

Information relevant to the considerations 
laid out in Article 2(7) of Commission 
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2020/568. 

Box 11 

Information relevant 

Information relevant to the considerations 
laid out in Article 3(3) of Commission 

 
 8 [159] 

to Article 3(3) 

Implementing Regulation (EU) 2020/568. 

Box 12 

Information relevant 
to Article 3(4) 

Information relevant to the considerations 
laid out in Article 3(4) of Commission 
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2020/568. 

Box 13 

Information relevant 
to Article 3(5) 

Information relevant to the considerations 
laid out in Article 3(5) of Commission 
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2020/568. 

Box 14 

All other relevant 
information 

Please provide any other information 
considered relevant in light of the 
provisions of Commission Implementing 
Regulation (EU) 2020/568. 

Box 15 

Declaration 

Declaration that the information provided 
in the form is true and given in good faith. 

 
 
 
 
 [159] 9
